summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the scheduling of meetings and calls, and the identification of a trial witness from JPMorgan in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It reveals coordination between the parties during the pre-trial and jury selection phase.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: An attorney from WilmerHale, corresponding with the prosecution to schedule meetings and discuss trial witness matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York involved in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, copied on the email chain.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the email subject line, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Pat
persons.context: An individual referenced in scheduling for a meeting, likely a colleague or client of the correspondents.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding scheduling and trial preparation in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, indicating a professional working relationship between defense and prosecution.
Stoddart is scheduling a meeting involving Pat, indicating a professional association.

events.title: Court Hearing
events.description: Mention of being in court most of the day for a hearing.

events.title: Jury Selection
events.description: Multiple references to jury selection being scheduled and underway, impacting meeting availability.

events.title: Subpoena Discussion
events.description: Discussion about providing a trial appearance subpoena to JPMorgan to identify a witness.

keyFacts: The emails are focused on scheduling calls and meetings between legal teams in the lead-up to Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The prosecution is seeking to identify and subpoena a witness from JPMorgan for the trial.
Jury selection was actively underway in November 2021, creating scheduling difficulties.
The correspondence shows professional coordination between defense attorney Allison Stoddart and prosecutor Anjan Sahni.
